Key Match Events: Cape Verde defeated Ghana 2-1 in their opening match of the 2023 Afcon.
Substitute Garry Rodrigues scored in stoppage time to secure the win for Cape Verde.
Jamiro Monteiro scored the opening goal for Cape Verde on 17 minutes.
Ghana's Majeed Ashimeru had a goal ruled out by VAR for offside before half-time.
Alexander Djiku equalized for Ghana on 57 minutes with a header from a corner-kick.
Ghana goalkeeper Richard Ofori made crucial saves to deny Cape Verde's Kenny Rocha and Garry Rodrigues.
Rodrigues scored the winning goal after a mix-up in the Ghana defense.
Post-Match Reflections: Ghana entered the 2023 Afcon with hopes of winning their fifth title.
Coach Chris Hughton will need to strategize for their next game against Egypt to progress from Group B.
Mohammed Kudus' absence due to a hamstring injury was a significant loss for Ghana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cape Verde's win places them at the top of Group B with three points.
Egypt and Mozambique drew 2-2 in their group match earlier in the day.
